note: ca. 1000–920 B.C.E.) and the divided monarchy (ca. 920–586 B.C.E.). The monarchical period is also known as Iron Age II, and some scholars refer to the period between the fall of Samaria (722 B.C.E.) and the fall of Jerusalem (586 B.C.E.) as Iron Age III.
title: between roughly 1200–586 B.C.E., known in the scholarly literature as the Iron Age and the Israelite period. The early Iron Age (ca. 1200–1000 B.C.E.) is known as Iron Age I and the settlement period, while the later portion of the period is divided into the united monarchy
